label: 衛門
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The Gate Guards, headquartered outside the Greater Imperial Palace, joined the escort on Imperial journeys and carried responsibility for the security of the entire compound beyond the Middle Enclosure, with particular emphasis on the gates, where they were supposed to maintain traffic checkpoints.  It was also their duty to keep watch fires burning at night (p. 814). [HW]
